Shuttered Burbank Fry's makes way for big mixed-use complex | Urbanize LA Skip to main content Los Angeles Los Angeles Neighborhoods Downtown Hollywood Regional Koreatown Santa Monica Westlake Long Beach Pasadena Culver City West Hollywood Orange County East Hollywood D Downtown East Hollywood H Hollywood East Hollywood R Regional East Hollywood K Koreatown East Hollywood S Santa Monica East Hollywood W Westlake East Hollywood L Long Beach East Hollywood P Pasadena East Hollywood C Culver City East Hollywood W West Hollywood East Hollywood O Orange County East Hollywood E East Hollywood East Hollywood View All‚Üí Urbanize Network National Seattle Atlanta Austin Chicago Dallas Washington DC Detroit Los Angeles New York Toronto San Francisco Projects Advertise Sign In My Account Sign Out Subscribe Search Advertisement Burbank Shuttered Burbank Fry's makes way for big mixed-use complex Out with flying saucer, in with 862 homes just south of Hollywood Burbank Airport View Project April 16, 2025, 6:30AM Steven Sharp Comments Gallery 4 Advertisement Four years after it closed its doors, the former Fry's Electronics near Hollywood Burbank Airport and its iconic flying saucer have bitten the dust. Courtyard of Burbank Aero Crossings TCA Architects Demolition of the store, which sits on an eight-acre property at 2311 Hollywood Way, will clear the way for the construction of LaTerra Development' s Burbank Aero Crossings, which was approved by the City of Burbank in 2021. Plans call for the construction of two seven-story buildings at featuring 862 residential units with 9,700 square feet of ground-floor commercial space and a central parking structure. TCA Architects is serving as the architect of record for the project, which was also approved with up to 152,000 square feet of office space. An exact timeline for the project, which was once expected to break ground in 2023, is currently unclear. 2311 N Hollywood Way - proposed site of Burbank Aero Crossing City of Burbank Aero Crossings is the second large development for LaTerra in Burbank, following a 573-unit complex located at 777 N. Front Street near the city's downtown Metrolink Station . The Fry's chain, which went out of business in 2021, left behind prime real estate at several locations in Southern California. One other has already been scooped up for redevelopment - the former Warner Center store at 6100 Canoga Avenue is set to make way for a 1.1 million-square-foot complex featuring housing and a hotel. About Us - Pacific Design Center About Showroom directory Shop The Building Leasing Book A Venue PDC Design Gallery Events Our Story & Heritage Show More Our Story Known nationally and internationally as the world‚Äôs most important home to over 70+ showrooms, the PDC represents over 2,000 leading manufacturers dedicated to the very best in residential and business interior furnishings, educational opportunities, and resource information. The PDC is home to over 80 luxury showrooms and offers an unparalleled line-up of residential and commercial products. Always at the forefront of its industry, the PDC provides its visitors ‚Äî which include some of the biggest names in interior design and architecture ‚Äî with unique experiences including informative yet entertaining seminars, professional programs, networking opportunities, exclusive design services and more. Heritage The Premier Resource for Fine Home Furnishings An architectural landmark anchoring Los Angeles‚Äô elite design district, Pacific Design Center (PDC) is the West Coast destination for global design. Award-winning Pacific Design Center is the West Coast‚Äôs leading resource for the traditional and contemporary residential and contract furnishings, fabrics, floor coverings, architectural products, wallcoverings, lighting, kitchen and bath products, and accessories. The 1.6 million square-foot campus presents nearly 100 boutique to international showroom brands , representing 2,200 product lines available to source by professional interior designers, architects, facility managers, decorators and dealers. Additionally, several showrooms are retail and open to the public, offering access to high-end home furnishings and d√©cor for design enthusiasts and consumers. Pacific Design Center also serves the needs of the design, entertainment and arts communities by providing dramatic public and private spaces for screenings, exhibitions, lectures, meetings, special events and receptions. A premier, multi-use facility, Pacific Design Center features two restaurants (Design Cafe & Silver Bullet Express); The SilverScreen Theater , a 294 seat state-of-the-art luxury film venue and reception facility; the Conference Center , a 200 seat facility fully equipped for conferences and meetings, and a Michael Graves designed Fitness Center . Designed by architect Cesar Pelli, FAIA, the beautifully landscaped, 14-acre campus is located in the City of West Hollywood, CA. Pacific Design Center‚Äôs ‚ÄúBlue Whale‚Äù opened in 1975 at 750,000 square-feet. Realizing Pelli‚Äôs original vision, the Green Building followed in 1988 at 450,000 square-feet and, finally, the Red Building in 2012 at 400,000 square-feet, offering class A, creative office space for premier businesses , including entertainment, fashion, technology and the arts. Pacific Design Center is located in the heart of West Hollywood, at the corner of Melrose Avenue and San Vicente Boulevard. Hours of operation are Monday through Friday from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM. Please contact your design professional or our Design Services department to refer a designer who will accompany you during your visit. 8687 Melrose Avenue West Hollywood, CA 90069 310 657 0800 Email Contact Show More Guidelines Show More Admission Policy The PDC is open to design trade professionals only. Admission to the showrooms varies according to each showroom‚Äôs individual policy. Design professionals (designers, architects, etc.) may accompany their clients during normal business hours. Design Clientele To make arrangements for your clients to visit the PDC without you: Write an email to Maria Hughes at mhughes@pacificdesigncenter.com with your client‚Äôs name, address and telephone number. Specify the showroom(s) you wish them to visit, a contact person and the terms and service you would like the showroom(s) to provide, i.e., memo samples, tear sheets, prices, etc. Specify the day your clients are to visit the PDC. If repeat showroom visits are to be made, indicate those dates in the letter. This letter must be signed by the design professional working with the client. Not all showrooms will allow visits by unaccompanied clients, so please check with the showroom in advance. Advise your clients they will be required to show a letter of introduction to every showroom they visit in the building. Members of the Public If you are not currently working with a designer but would like to take advantage of PDC‚Äôs vast array of exclusive inventory, you should contact Corey Pernicano at 310 360 6418 or email cpernicano@pacificdesigncenter.com to coordinate admission to showrooms. Generally, showrooms will not allow public admittance to their suites without correspondence from the building. Staff & Board of Directors - Diamond Head Theatre Skip to content Box Office: (808) 733-0274 | Business Office: (808) 733-0277 Facebook Instagram YouTube LinkedIn Email Search for: Shows & Tickets Buy Tickets Season Subscriptions Seat Map Show Archive Subscriber Login Donate Annual Giving Capital Campaign Producer‚Äôs Club Sponsorship ‚ÄòIlima Awards Auditions Show Auditions Shooting Stars Classes Year-Round Classes Summer Musical Theatre Experience Shooting Stars Instructors Scholarships About Staff & Board of Directors Instructors Volunteer Rentals News Show Archive Your New Theatre Theatrical Arts Building Make a Gift Sponsor a Seat Photos News Capital Campaign Donors Contact BUY TICKETS Staff & Board of Directors Jacque Vaughn 2025-07-23T06:29:51-10:00 STAFF & BOARD OF DIRECTORS We bring the magic of theatre to all Trevor Tamashiro, Executive Director Trevor joined Diamond Head Theatre as Executive Director in April 2023. Born and raised in Hawaii, and a graduate of Punahou School, he brings nearly 20 years of experience in nonprofit executive leadership. Trevor started his journey in New York City working for Broadway Dance Center. Other positions include: Chief Advancement Officer of The Diller-Quaile School of Music; Deputy Director of Saratoga International Theater Institute; and Deputy/Program Director for The Drama League of New York. Trevor is a member of the Association of Fundraising Professionals and is a Certified Fund Raising Executive (CFRE). He holds a degree in Theatre Arts from University of Miami, a Master of Business Administration degree from Pace University, and a Master of Science degree in Nonprofit Management from Columbia University. John Rampage, Artistic Director John Rampage is a performer, actor, choreographer, and director who has served as Diamond Head Theatre‚Äôs Artistic Director since 1995. He is the creative mastermind behind all of the theatre‚Äôs productions and programs, overseeing the curation of two or more shows each season and selects directors, musical directors, and set designers. His relationship with the theatre began in 1975 where he performed as Tommy Gilas in the 1975 production of Music Man. In the 1980s, Rampage danced and sang his way across the U.S. and Europe and returned in 1991 as choreographer of Evita. More than 120 productions have been shared with the community under his oversight. A 47-time Po‚Äòokela Award winner for excellence in the theatre, John is also the recipient of the Hawaii State Theatre Council 2006 Pierre Bowman Award. Ovation Hollywood‚ÄÇ¬∑‚ÄÇRSM Design ¬∑ Principle Centered Design About Work Services Markets Contact News & Ideas Search Hollywood, California Ovation Hollywood Hollywood & Highland, the once well-known landmark destination adjacent to the TCL Chinese Theatre and home of the Academy Awards, now has a dynamic new brand and project positioning, and has been renamed to Ovation Hollywood. The creative team at RSM Design worked closely with Gensler, OJB Landscape Architecture, Taylor and Miller Design, Ludlow Kingsley, and others to completely reimagine this iconic destination. After completing an extensive analysis of the property, including wayfinding strategies, signage entitlements/inventory, flow patterns, and guest interactions, RSM Design created timeless wayfinding solutions for the complex labyrinth of interior and exterior spaces. A completely new wayfinding strategy was developed to guide visitors around the once confusing circulation paths. Additionally, the RSM Design team designed a fresh palette of brand murals and other placemaking graphics to respect the new brand character and create a sense of place that is unique to Hollywood. Markets Mixed-Use Retail Services Environmental Graphic Design Wayfinding Design Digital Integration Public Art & Murals Experiential Graphics Design Awards 2023 Creative Communication Awards Winner: Functional Typography & Wayfinding Client DJM¬†Capital Partners Inc GAW Capital Partners Image via Hollywoodpartnership.com (Photo courtesy Marc Wannamaker/Bison Archives) A HISTORIC HOLLYWOOD LANDMARK The Hollywood Hotel stood at the intersection of Hollywood and Highland for the first half of the twentieth century. Over the years, the site has been redeveloped to accommodate a variety of attractions. In 2001, Hollywood & Highland opened as a large-scale retail destination with entertainment amenities. The destination was popular for visitors, but over time became outdated and less attractive. Now, the destination is being revitalized once again, still with retail and entertainment in mind. Ovation Hollywood is set to become the premier Hollywood spot for both tourists and locals, with a modernized and design-forward aesthetic. See more RSM Design retail work ‚Ä∫ A $100 MILLION DOLLAR MAKEOVER Ovation Hollywood is an attraction where locals, tourists, and entertainment merge. However, the retail and entertainment destination wasn‚Äôt always as sophisticated and glamorous as it is today. The $100 million dollar makeover, led by DJM and GAW Capital, included demolition of the controversial Babylonian-themed archway and oversized elephant statues. The new architecture and archway features a timeless white facade and a playful mural design by Geoff McFetridge. Now, as visitors enter the space they‚Äôre welcomed by a revamped open courtyard, lush landscape, new spaces for offices, restaurants, and retail, as well as placemaking and graphics to bring a sense of whimsy and fun. The goal for the new space was to create something that is forward-looking and welcomes Los Angeles‚Äô diversity and optimism. A NEW BRANDED ENVIRONMENT The team at RSM Design collaborated with branding agency Ludlow Kingsley to implement environmental graphics at Ovation Hollywood. The key brand principle is celebration: of culture, diversity, and accomplishments of the Los Angeles community. Utilizing the brand guidelines, logo, and color palette, RSM Design crafted placemaking graphics and mural designs intended to invite visitors to share in the celebratory experience. WAYFINDING FOR A LOS ANGELES ATTRACTION Ovation Hollywood occupies 387,000 square-feet of property in Los Angeles. The site includes the TCL Chinese Theatre and the DolbyTheatre, home of the Academy Awards. It‚Äôs also located along the famousHollywood Walk of Fame, one of the most visited tourist destinations in Los Angeles, and features views of the Hollywood sign. For as sought-after as an attraction that Ovation Hollywood is, wayfinding plays a critical role in the guest experience. Wayfinding signage provides visitors with a clear and seamless journey from the entrance, to the parking garage, around the site, and to the exit. The goal of the wayfinding system at Ovation Hollywood is to clearly identify key destinations as well as remain true to the brand aesthetic. Wayfinding and branded touch points work to move groups of people from point A to point B in a clear and cohesive manner. In addition to offering a sense of security, wayfinding and placemaking also work to animate the brand and bring a sense of character that visitors can relate to and feel excited about. Antwerp Space is a very experienced Belgian space engineering company and a well-recognized industrial player by the European Space Agency and the European Commission. Antwerp Space has an established presence in the European space market and is in most cases the leader of technically complex space projects, supported by a consortium of partners from all over Europe. The company employs highly skilled engineers and technicians from all over the world, the majority of which hold an engineering degree, with strong expertise in the areas of digital signal processing, hardware and software design, as well as in project management and technical leadership. OHB SE Group: big in space Antwerp Space is part of the larger OHB SE group (ISIN: DE0005936124, Prime Standard), one of Europe‚Äôs success stories in the field of contemporary space. Today it can call itself the third largest space group in Europe. The OHB SE group has been growing at a steady pace over the last three decades and its footprint in Europe has continuously expanded. Nowadays, there are subsidiaries in Austria, Germany, Italy, Sweden, Luxembourg, Greece, the Czech Republic and of course Belgium. Despite its size, OHB SE is still a family business, run by the Fuchs family. She has over 20 years of experience in pre-development, design, construction administration and project management specializing in luxury high-rise condominiums and mixed- use projects such as 50 Biscayne, Trump Towers I, II, & III by The Related Group, and 5252 Paseo and 5300 Paseo in Downtown Doral by Codina Partners. Alex is a 11-year resident of the City of Hollywood. She has always yearned to serve in her own community, so she feels privileged to be managing her current projects. LEED AP, Program Manager Consultant jcortes@hollywoodfl.org Jose is a graduate of Florida International University with a Masters Degree in Construction Management. Christopher Roschek, PE, Chief Resiliency Officer croschek@hollywoodfl.org Chris is the first Chief Resiliency Officer (CRO) for the City of Hollywood.  In his role, he is responsible for leading and guiding the City‚Äôs efforts in building a strategic resiliency plan that will enhance safety and quality of life across the City and preserve property values. A licensed Professional Engineer, he has over 27 years of experience in local municipal government, planning, engineering, construction, and environmental protection.  He is a graduate of Syracuse University with a Master‚Äôs Degree in Environmental Engineering. Throughout his career he has focused specifically on water-related environmental issues.  He has been active with the Southeast Florida Climate Change Compact and other professional organizations, sharing sustainability and resilience strategies related to climate change, sea level rise, and stormwater management. In his free time, Chris enjoys being outdoors at the beach and exercising.  He also loves music, going to concerts, spending time with his son, family and friends, and watching all the Detroit pro sports teams ‚Äì Tigers, Lions, Pistons, and Red Wings. Dana Nelson, LEED AP , Construction Support Services Manager dnelson@hollywoodfl.org Dana graduated from Metropolitan State University in Denver with a degree in Aerospace Science. He spent 16 years in construction management working with owners, architects, engineers, community members, and subcontractors. Over the years, his focus has been in building for municipalities, healthcare, education and the pharmaceuticals industry. Certified as a LEED professional, he has a passion for transforming projects into energy efficient and healthy places for end users to enjoy. He is a 28-year Air Force Veteran and currently serves as a Lieutenant Colonel in the Air Force Reserves. Luis Lopez, PE, Engineering Support Services Manager llopez@hollywoodfl.org Luis works in the planning, design, construction and oversight of Capital Improvement and General Obligation Bond Projects. He is a graduate of Florida International University with a degree in Civil Engineering. A true public servant, he has worked in local government for more than 25 years. Heather Guenot, PE , Senior Project Manager hguenot@hollywoodfl.org Heather is a graduate of Purdue University with a degree in Civil Engineering. She is a licensed Professional Engineer with over 14 years of experience in roadway design, construction, and project management. Her career has been dedicated to bringing public infrastructure projects from concept through construction, with a focus on cost-effective, sustainable infrastructure. She is an active member of the Society of Women Engineers. In her free time, she enjoys volunteering as a Girl Scout Troop leader, soccer coach, and in various roles at her children‚Äôs schools. Kenneth Jenkins, Field Service Manager kejenkins@hollywoodfl.org Kenneth has a Bachelor's Degree in Architecture from the University of Kentucky, and has worked in the construction industry for over 30 years. He provides construction and field project management to the Design and Construction Management project team (horizontal, vertical construction projects); prepares QA/QC, safety, field, permit and inspection reports as needed for the successful completion of the projects. He also c oordinates architects, contractors, inspectors, supervisory and technical staff during the construction phase. In his leisure time, he enjoys spending time with his family, camping, and boating. Karyn Sashi, RA, Senior Project Manager ksashi@hollywoodfl.org Karyn is a licensed architect and interior designer. She graduated from Florida Atlantic University with a Bachelors degree in Architecture and  has been working in the architecture field since 2012; specializing in design, preparation of construction documents, and project management. Her experience includes the design of mixed-use projects, commercial facilities, residential apartments, and cruise terminals projects. Karyn is an advanced certified scuba diver who loves exploring the South Florida reefs and wrecks along the coast. When she is not diving, she loves spending her time outdoors with her family; walking, biking, and enjoying the Florida sun. Rudy Damas, MSCM, Project Manager rdamas@hollywoodfl.org Rudy has a Bachelors Degree in Civil Engineering and a Masters degree in Construction Management from Florida International University. With over ten years of experience in both the private and public sectors, he has extensive experience in management consulting and team management. As a project manager with the City of Hollywood, he analyzes and reviews the design studies prepared by either in-house staff or professional consultant firms managing project resources and budgets. Rudy has a passion for photography and videography and, on the weekends, serves as a volunteer minister in the camera department at his church. Kendra Parker, Special Projects and Administrative Manager kparker@hollywoodfl.org Kendra is a graduate of Florida International University and has over 25 years of experience in management, marketing, PR, research projects, and communications across the hospitality, education and government industries. In her role, she manages special projects as assigned by the Director and oversees the development of departmental initiatives. She also acts as the department's liaison for the City's General Obligation Bond Advisory Committee. Kendra is a certified fitness and nutrition coach and, inspired by the role exercise played in her healing and recovery after cancer treatment, develops wellness programs for breast cancer survivors. She also co-founded Cushy Healing Pillows, along with her mother; hand-sewing and donating mastectomy pillows to breast cancer patients. Ana Faria, MSCM, Project Manager afaria@hollywoodfl.org Ana is a Civil Engineer who graduated from Universidad Cat√≥lica Andr√©s Bello in Caracas, Venezuela. She holds a Master of Science in Construction Management from Florida International University in Miami, FL. Ana has over ten years of construction experience in Florida, having worked on residential, commercial, and civil projects, including Cypress Bay High School, Vista Park Fire Rescue Station 55 in Weston, The Palace at Weston, Miami Country Day School, and 321 Ocean Drive in Miami Beach, among others. She also worked as part of the team providing program management services for the Broward County Public Schools SMART bond program. Ana has previously worked for several construction firms in Miami and served as President of the National Association of Women in Construction (NAWIC), Miami Chapter. Outside of work, she enjoys traveling and cruising the seven seas with her husband and sons. Ramses Terrero. CBC, Project Manager rterrero@hollywoodfl.org Ramses is a Certified Building Contractor. Elaine Franklin Environmental Sustainability Coordinator efranklin@hollywoodfl.org Elaine has a Master‚Äôs degree in conservation biology from the University of Hawaii at Manoa. She brings years of diverse experience to the role of Environmental Sustainability Coordinator. From providing educational workshops for residents to drafting and implementing policies aimed at sustainable resource use, Elaine engages all City departments to improve Hollywood‚Äôs environment for current and future generations by reducing carbon emissions city-wide, conserving water, increasing our tree canopy, and much more. Prior to her life in Florida, Elaine developed and delivered an environmental sustainability curriculum to youths in Eswatini/Swaziland, Southern Africa, through her own company. She earned her Permaculture Design Certification in South Africa and guided low-income residents in establishing abundant, diverse and sustainable food gardens in their own yards. She has studied the impacts of human activities on birds throughout the world, most recently coauthoring a paper on the effects of a new transportation project on bird communities in Equatorial Guinea. Elaine is a CLEO Climate Speaker, a facilitator of the En-ROADS climate simulator, a Florida Master Gardener, and an avid cyclist. Victoria Ulysse, Assistant Project Manager vulysse@hollywoodfl.org Victoria earned her Bachelor of Science Degree in Civil Engineering from Florida International University. Her expertise is rooted in overseeing the design, construction, and construction administration phases of Local Agency Program (LAP) projects for the Florida Department of Transportation. These federally funded endeavors encompassed a range of initiatives such as safety and re-surfacing projects, bicycle and pedestrian facilities, traffic calming projects, as well as bridges and tunnels. Notably, she demonstrated proficiency in securing additional funding for Local Agencies in need. Victoria excels in cultivating collaborative relationships with team members, stakeholders, and regulatory bodies, leveraging her academic background and hands-on experience to contribute significantly to the success of each project she takes on. Beyond her professional pursuits, Victoria finds joy in spending quality time with her family and indulging in hobbies such as beach volleyball, cooking, and gardening. Tiffany Phillip, Accountant tphillip@hollywoodfl.org Tiffany graduated from St. John's University in Queens, New York with a Bachelor of Science Degree in Accounting.
